headline: Spinach Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
description: This portobello stuffed mushroom recipe is made with a flavorful filling of pepperoni, spinach, Parmesan, and mozzarella, topped with bread crumbs.
name: Spinach Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
recipeIngredient: 4 large portobello mushroom caps, stems and gills removed
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Brush both sides of portobello mushrooms with Italian dressing. Arrange mushroom on a baking sheet, gill-sides up.
Bake in the preheated oven until tender, about 12 minutes. Drain any juice that has accumulated in mushrooms.
Beat egg, garlic, salt, and black pepper together in a large bowl.
Stir spinach, pepperoni, Parmesan cheese, 3 tablespoons mozzarella cheese, and 3 tablespoons bread crumbs into eggs until evenly mixed.
Divide spinach mixture over mushroom caps; sprinkle mushrooms with remaining 1 tablespoon mozzarella cheese and 1 tablespoon bread crumbs.
Return mushrooms to the oven; bake until topping is golden brown and cheese is melted, about 10 minutes more.

review.reviewBody: Loved this recipe! I used button mushrooms, didnt add pepperoni, and used a raspberry vinaigrette I had on hand. I made this twice over the holidays, it was a hit! I had some filling left over and added it to the old fashioned stuffing recipe, also a huge hit!

I can't stand when I try a recipe that clearly wasn't tried out by whomever posted it. Don't try the Italian dressing step. Just skip it all together. You lose half the size of the mushroom and ruin the texture into this sham of soggy unpleasantness
Always comes through when I need a switch up!
I used Italian bread crumbs and turkey pepperoni. My family and I absolutely loved them!!
These came out Amazing, I didn't sweat the mushrooms first, I just brushed them with the dressing, stuffed baked for 20 minutes they came out firm and delicious !

This recipe was a great starting point for tonight's dinner. I didn't have any pepperoni so use a sausage patty instead. I also had a supply of feta and substituted that for the mozzarella and parmesan. I added chopped shallot and yellow pepper that I sauteed in a little olive oil. The resulting dish was delicious - moist, tangy from the feta, and substantial due to the sausage. I can foresee changing the stuffing ingredients based on what is in the frig and coming out with a great dinner each time. Thanks for getting me started with this!

This is a great recipe! I made it for my wife and I (trying to eat a little better) and they’re simply delicious and filling. I did adjust some of the recipe, not measuring the cheeses (extra), added Italian seasoning and an extra egg since it wasn’t enough filling for how large ours were and it turned out amazing! Highly recommend.

Cut down the bulky spinach with a food processor. Place into a small skillet to warm it. The raw garlic is too strong; sautee it. To save calories, buy 70% reduced fat pepperoni slices. Chop pepperoni in food processor. I used Panko bread crumbs. This delicious stuffing would work on yellow squash, zucchini, tomatoes, etc...

This is a five star recipe for sure. I made this as an appetizer using baby portobello mushrooms. 
It was a big hit. Even with some family members that aren't mushroom fans.
It was too garlicky and didn’t hold together. The taste wasn’t great either. Would not make it again
My wife joyed them. Melon scoop made the job easier of clearing out mushrooms. I didn't have pepperoni,but found some deli buffalo chicken worked just as well.
I've made these twice they where a big hit. I did cook the spinach and garlic before adding to the stuffing mix. very tasty

I loved this recipe! I left out the bread crumbs, added four strips of bacon crumbled. I also wilted the spinach before mixing all ingredients. (made it easier to stuff the mushrooms. My guests LOVED them!

Delicious and simple full of earthy flavor with italian accents.
Kick it up with smoked mozzarella.

I used what I had-fresh spinach, chopped with onions, garlic, Parmesan with cream cheese topped with bread crumbs and Parmesan as a side with chicken breasts. Next time I’ll add red bell peppers (I just forgot). My fist time eating or making stuffed shrooms and they were fantasy!!
Great healthy, flavorful recipe as is!
Delicious! I omitted the pepperoni for vegetarian option and I put a little more cheese on top. I’ve made this recipe 3 times now and it’s always a hit with family.
It was okay. I may try it again with alterations .

I did make a few changes plus I wanted it to cook quick. I had 2 mushrooms so I have some filling left. I did a mix of chopped spinach, basil pesto, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese and seasoned breadcrumbs. I air fried them at 370 for 8 minutes after heating up the air fryer for 8 minutes. Delicious! Hubby wants more so I will be picking up some more portobello mushrooms tomorrow.

This was a last minute choice for dinner and it was delicious! I substituted Italian dressing for Greek and used bacon bits instead of pepperoni. I didn’t use bread crumbs but it didn’t need it. Super easy and tasty, I ate it as main meal with guacamole and cucumbers. A++
Amazing!!! I added some onion & it was so good!

Thank you. These are fabulous, easy and reheated the next day in the microwave to taste like they were just made! 

I used chopped onion instead of pepperoni and added a couple dashes of tabasco sauce. I also added little more cheese (I love cheese). I did wilt the spinach and onion in the microwave before mixing the stuffing as one reviewer suggested- good idea.

Oh my gosh!!! After several years using this site-this is my first review : )! I have made it twice following the recipe exactly -with the red pepper sub. This is a seriously good recipe and I recommend it highly! My husband and I are fairly new to plant based eating and this recipe makes it so easy! Thank you for sharing it!

I used summer sausage instead of pepperoni. It tasted delicious!!! Also used Ritz crackers instead of breadcrumbs b/c I didn't have any. The mushrooms were perfect! We paired them with blackened mahi mahi and green beans! SO good!
I made this for a main course meal. I used genoa salami instead of pepperoni and pre-wilted the spinach (as others have suggested). It was a very good light meal that I'll make again!
Great recipe! I added red pepper flakes and a bag of baby spinach. Also made a couple with goat cheese. Turned out delicious
I will definitely make this again, it was delicious
This was really good, I did add some additional seasoning. I will make this recipe again.
This is fantastic! I used a little less spinach but made no substitutions. Had leftover "stuffing" and used it with scrambled eggs this morning. This is a keeper!
Very good. Followed the recipe as written; left out the pepperoni because I didn’t have any.
super easy and hubby kept saying how delicious they were! used less breadcrumbs than in recipe to keep carb count in check. definitely a keeper!
Easy and came out great and delicious
A meal all by itself........fabulous!!

Are used this recipe on six portobellos and I still had a lot left I made an omelette out of it the next day it was very good three other people have asked me for the recipe so it must be OK LOL I’m not the best at cooks but this came out really well

I sort of combined a couple of recipes. Wiped the mushrooms with Italian dressing. Roasted gills up for 12 minutes. After resting them I dumped the fluid. I stuffed the mushrooms with spinach, egg, cheese and bread crumbs and continued baking for another 15 minutes. Very tasty.
Family loved it. I added 6 strips of bacon to the mix and used panko break crumbs and added my own Italian spices. Was very filling and tasted great!

I made this for this past Mother's Day for Brunch .. My Step Dad is a Major Foodie .. He not only LOVED The Recipe ; asked for the recipe ! This Was One of The Highest Compliment Coming From Him! Thanks Tons --
Excellent!! Easy to prepare and they make a great meal.
I made it for the first time. I turned out well
Super easy and fast. The whole family enjoyed it..
With so many possible alterations, the 'shrooms have been at our table under many disguises
This dish was delicious! I enjoyed one as a light lunch. The recipe was easy to follow and came out perfect!
Great recipe and so easy to make. I omitted pepperoni and used chopped red bell pepper. I didn’t have Italian dressing so I used olive oil with Italian seasoning and garlic salt. Excellent!

Made this for the first time tonight! It was the bomb! Will be making this again! I used a little more of the cheeses just because it didn't seem like enough. It was cheesy and yummy! If you plan on having guests for supper you will wow them with this simple recipe!
I used a homemade vinegarette inside of the Italian salad dressing and it worked well.
Great no meat option
Excellent recipe. Delicious

I substituted Canadian Bacon for the pepperoni, as pepperoni gives us heartburn. I will make it again, but I will only use half as much spinach. I way overstuffed the mushrooms and have enough left to stuff 4 more. Will add the leftovers to scrambled eggs for breakfast.
I followed suggestions of others and sautéed onion, the gills, and the garlic first then added in the spinach so it would wilt. It was great.
I have made this dish twice now, and my husband loves it
YUM! I made a Vegan version and it was fantastic!!!

While that unflattering photo accompanying this recipe looks somewhat like a withered and weathered turtle (sorry!) This is indeed a very great recipe and one you can tweak to your liking! I prefer red bell pepper AND pepperoni! Thanks for sharing!!!
Easy to make and delicious!

Delicious. Easy to make. 

I will make these again.

I did, used Balsamic vinegar which I had, chopped up 6 cloves of garlic, split btwn steamed spinach and mushrooms, used HOt It sausage casing removed and sauteed in same pan as the sauteed onions also used habanaro cheese grated very small and asiago cheese grated small with 3, 4" diameter portobello shrooms. Never made this before. It was awesome! Will definitely make this again. I did take a picture, Posted it on twitter.

Made several changes. Added a bunch of chopped fresh parsley to the chopped spinach. Used 16oz ricotta cheese and added another egg. Substituted the pepper for the pepperoni as suggested. Added two teaspoons of Italian seasoning. Used Fresh Expressions salad dressing to brush the mushrooms prior to the first bake. Got lots of compliments and passed the modified recipe on. Also topped each mushroom with grated smoked Gouda for another layer of favor plus it browns beautifully.
Wow! This was fantastic. I loved the spinach filling.
I loved it and will definitely make it again. I did not use pepperoni in it and added paprika to the spinach mixture. I also brushed the mushrooms with basalmic vinegar and olive oil.
will definitely make again

I used some left-over Cumberland pork sausages (cooked) The leftover mushroom gills and stalks (I chopped them together with some mushroom caps I had) I and made a wonderful soup using Robert Carriers recipe. Superb duo!!
Really Taste and delicious
These are scrumptious! I used them as a main dish with a side of rice and steamed vegetables.
Good, but next time will add more pepperoni and mozzarella. Maybe add some celery and sweet red pepper---

I made this recipe using smaller mushrooms as appetizers for Thanksgiving. They were easy to prepare, although the recipe called for the mushroom stems to be discarded, I minced them and added them to the spinach mixture. 
They were a big hit with my family. Plan on preparing this recipe again for Xmas Eve.
I used panko as the bread crumbs. Worked very well. My guest said we should make this more often. a 4 star as we though it needed a little ump. Maybe pepper jack for a little heat.
I found that there was a lot of the spinach and egg mix, so I did 8 mushrooms instead of 4. But it is soooo yummy!
Yum!! bUT WHY WASTE THE gills and stems? They are good food and nutricious ….

I’ve made this recipe twice. Once with the large caps and once with smaller ones. My large ones seemed to flatten out on me quite a bit as opposed to the smaller ones that kept their shape very well. Tasted amazing both times!
I mixed in some pasta sauce I had on hand and baked each mushroom in a 6" ramekin. Prepared garlic risotto and served it with them for an entre'.
For step 7, I needed an additional 20 minutes not 10
When I made this for my husband and myself he said "whenever we want pizza,,,make these!". Great recipe!!!
Made two of these. They were great!!! Made some adaptations-sauteed red pepper and garlic and added spinach to pan. Let everything cool before filling.
Oh my goodness these are so delicious. Very easy to pull together. We had these with baked chicken and it was oh so good. This is a keeper.
I did not put any pepperoni, and I added extra cheese to substitute. I really loved the mushrooms, and they were really simple to make.
This came out great, served it with spaghetti squash with marinara for a non-meat meal.
Fantastic! Made it exactly as written and it will be a favorite in our house.
Simple and delicious!

I made this tonight for dinner. I did not add the pepperoni cause I can't eat any red meat for medical purposes. My side dish was fresh asparagus (cooked in 1\4 cup butter, 2 fresh squeezed lemons, 2 cloves fresh minced garlic, and three sprigs of dill), and cantaloupe. I highly recommend this dish.

No change is needed as far as the recipe. I will make 1 change and at is to triple the recipe. I didn't come close to having enough. I will definitely make it again and again this was a big hit with the family.

I love this recipe! While this recipe calls for pepperoni I used ground turkey and it was amazing. Like the other reviews said, make sure to wilt you spinach down before you put it on your mushrooms. I mixed mine in with my ground turkey and a little extra cheese.. mmm it was wonderful. Such a delicious recipe!
So simple and easy to make!!!
delicious!!

Other than using a different cheese because I didn't have mozzarella I followed the recipe ... mostly. I used too much spinach and I didn't chop it first so it was hard to work with but they still turned out great and I will make them again.
Made it as written. It was quite good.
Instead of pepperoni are used ground beef.

I switched up the pepperoni & mozzarella for thinly sliced ham & cheddar. Also added sauted onions & added the garlic & ham to them, removed from heat and then added the spinach to wilt it. Cooled for a couple of minutes & added the egg mixture & cheddar.
Followed recipe exactly. This is a new family favourite. Made as a veggie side dish. Big hit!

Made this and it was GOOD
I add tomatoes and alfredo sauce to the stuffed portobello mushrooms
Fantastic. Do NOT ad the salt. perfect without it.
I did sub bacon for the pep because I had it in hand and wilted the spinach and garlic in that along with a finely diced Jalapeno. It really did turn out amazing!

What a great recipe! Delicious. The only thing I did differently was to add bacon bits instead of pepperoni. And that was because I didn't have pepperoni in the house but I had everything else. YUMMY!!!!

This is a super easy receipe loaded with flavor! Tastes just like the stuffed mushrooms caps my husband and I order when we go out for dinner!! Will definitely make these more often. I chopped my spinach in my little food processor - super quick
I have made this several times. This last time, I was out of pepperoni but had pancetta. OMG. We wanted more of these! I would have had just these for dinner!
Made exactly as written and these were incredible!! Served with melted butter over the top. YUM!
Easy and tasty portabella mushroom recipe. I left out the pepperoni, could substitute chopped ham. Makes a fast delicious lunch.
Replaced the pepperoni with tomatoes. Still wonderful and easy. Great recipe, thanks.

Delicious. I only used half the spinach and it was plenty.
Family enjoyed it very much.
Awesome! It's definitely made my favourites list

OMG, this was amazing!! I expected these to taste good, but was blown away by how delicious they were. The only thing I would change is to not add salt. The pepperoni makes it plenty salty. Very easy recipe, great directions and the results were fantastic! Will definitely make again.
